From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Asturian

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin decidere.

Verb

[edit]

decidir (first-person singular indicative present decido, past participle decidíu)

  1. to decide (to resolve or settle)
  2. to decide (to resolve a dispute, give judgement)

Conjugation

[edit]
Conjugation of decidir
infinitive decidir
gerundive decidiendo
participle m decidíu, f decidida, n decidío, m pl decidíos, f pl decidíes
person first singular
yo 		second singular
tu 		third singular
él/elli 		first plural
nosotros/nós 		second plural
vosotros/vós 		third plural
ellos
indicative present decido decides decide decidimos decidís deciden
imperfect decidía decidíes decidía decidíemos/decidíamos decidíeis/decidíais decidíen
preterite decidí decidiesti/decidisti decidió decidiemos/decidimos decidiestis/decidistis decidieron
pluperfect decidiere/decidiera decidieres/decidieras decidiere/decidiera decidiéremos/decidiéramos decidiereis/decidierais decidieren/decidieran
future decidiré decidirás decidirá decidiremos decidiréis decidirán
conditional decidiría decidiríes decidiría decidiríemos/decidiríamos decidiríeis/decidiríais decidiríen
subjunctive present decida decidas decida decidamos decidáis decidan
imperfect decidiere/decidiera decidieres/decidieras decidiere/decidiera decidiéremos/decidiéramos decidiereis/decidierais decidieren/decidieran
imperative decidi decidíi

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin decīdere, with normal change of conjugation to -ir.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central, Balearic) [də.siˈði]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [de.siˈðiɾ]
  • Audio (Catalonia):(file)
  • Rhymes: -i(ɾ)
  • Homophone: decidí

Verb

[edit]

decidir (first-person singular present decideixo, first-person singular preterite decidí, past participle decidit)

  1. to decide

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of decidir (third conjugation, with -eix-)
infinitive decidir
gerund decidint
past participle masculine feminine
singular decidit decidida
plural decidits decidides
person singular plural
first second third first second third
indicative jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present decideixo decideixes decideix decidim decidiu decideixen
imperfect decidia decidies decidia decidíem decidíeu decidien
future decidiré decidiràs decidirà decidirem decidireu decidiran
preterite decidí decidires decidí decidírem decidíreu decidiren
conditional decidiria decidiries decidiria decidiríem decidiríeu decidirien
subjunctive jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present decideixi decideixis decideixi decidim decidiu decideixin
imperfect decidís decidissis decidís decidíssim decidíssiu decidissin
imperative — tu vostè nosaltres vosaltres
vós 		vostès
affirmative — decideix decideixi decidim decidiu decideixin
negative (no) — no decideixis no decideixi no decidim no decidiu no decideixin

Related terms

[edit]
  • decisió
  • decisiu

Further reading

[edit]
  • “decidir”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007
  • “decidir”, in Gran Diccionari de la Llengua Catalana, Grup Enciclopèdia Catalana, 2025
  • “decidir” in Diccionari normatiu valencià, Acadèmia Valenciana de la Llengua.
  • “decidir” in Diccionari català-valencià-balear, Antoni Maria Alcover and Francesc de Borja Moll, 1962.

Galician

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin dēcīdere.

Verb

[edit]

decidir (first-person singular present decido, first-person singular preterite decidín, past participle decidido)
decidir (first-person singular present decido, first-person singular preterite decidim or decidi, past participle decidido, reintegrationist norm)

  1. to decide; to resolve; to settle
  2. to decide (make a judgment)

Conjugation

[edit]

Related terms

[edit]
  • decisión

Ido

[edit]

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /det͡siˈdir/

Verb

[edit]

decidir

  1. past infinitive of decidar

Occitan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin dēcīdere.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • Audio (Béarn):(file)

Verb

[edit]

decidir

  1. to decide

Conjugation

[edit]

Related terms

[edit]
  • decision

Portuguese

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin dēcīdere, with change of conjugation.

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /de.siˈd͡ʒi(ʁ)/ [de.siˈd͡ʒi(h)]
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /de.siˈd͡ʒi(ʁ)/ [de.siˈd͡ʒi(h)]
    • (São Paulo) IPA(key): /de.siˈd͡ʒi(ɾ)/
    • (Rio de Janeiro) IPA(key): /de.siˈd͡ʒi(ʁ)/ [de.siˈd͡ʒi(χ)]
    • (Southern Brazil) IPA(key): /de.siˈd͡ʒi(ɻ)/
 
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /dɨ.siˈdiɾ/ [dɨ.siˈðiɾ]
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /dɨ.siˈdiɾ/ [dɨ.siˈðiɾ]
    • (Southern Portugal) IPA(key): /dɨ.siˈdi.ɾi/ [dɨ.siˈði.ɾi]

  • Audio (Portugal (Porto)):(file)

Verb

[edit]

decidir (first-person singular present decido, first-person singular preterite decidi, past participle decidido)

  1. to decide
  2. to determine
  3. to resolve
  4. to deliberate

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of decidir (See Appendix:Portuguese verbs)

(tu) 		Third-person

Negative (não) não decidas não decida não decidamos não decidais não decidam

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin decidere.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /deθiˈdiɾ/ [d̪e.θiˈð̞iɾ] (Spain)
  • IPA(key): /desiˈdiɾ/ [d̪e.siˈð̞iɾ] (Latin America, Philippines)
  • Rhymes: -iɾ
  • Syllabification: de‧ci‧dir

Verb

[edit]

decidir (first-person singular present decido, first-person singular preterite decidí, past participle decidido)

  1. to decide, to make up one's mind, to determine, to choose to
  2. to decide on
  3. to rule
    El juez podría decidir que fue muerte accidental.
    The judge could rule it an accidental death.

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of decidir (See Appendix:Spanish verbs)

gerund decidiendo
past participle masculine feminine
singular decidido decidida
plural decididos decididas
singular plural

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.
